titles.ar: بَابُ أَنَّهُ لَيْسَ فِي تَرْكِ الْحَجِّ خِيَرَةٌ وَ أَنَّ مَنْ حُبِسَ عَنْهُ فَبِذَنْبٍ
titles.en: Chapter 33 – There is no goodness in neglecting the Hajj, and if one is withheld from it, so it is due to sin

titles.ar: بَابُ أَنَّهُ لَوْ تَرَكَ النَّاسُ الْحَجَّ لَجَاءَهُمُ الْعَذَابُ
titles.en: Chapter 34 – It is such that if the people were to neglect the Hajj, the Punishment would come to them

titles.ar: بَابُ مَنْ يَخْرُجُ مِنْ مَكَّةَ لَا يُرِيدُ الْعَوْدَ إِلَيْهَا
titles.en: Chapter 32 – The one who goes out from Makkah not intending the return to it

titles.ar: بَابُ أَنَّهُ لَيْسَ فِي تَرْكِ الْحَجِّ خِيَرَةٌ وَ أَنَّ مَنْ حُبِسَ عَنْهُ فَبِذَنْبٍ
titles.en: Chapter 33 – There is no goodness in neglecting the Hajj, and if one is withheld from it, so it is due to sin

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (17/153)
text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنِ النَّضْرِ بْنِ شُعَيْبٍ عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ عِمْرَانَ بْنِ مِيثَمٍ عَنْ سَمَاعَةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ لِي مَا لَكَ لَا تَحُجُّ فِي الْعَامِ فَقُلْتُ مُعَامَلَةٌ كَانَتْ بَيْنِي وَ بَيْنَ قَوْمٍ وَ أَشْغَالٌ وَ عَسَى أَنْ يَكُونَ ذَلِكَ خِيَرَةٌ فَقَالَ لَا وَ اللَّهِ مَا فَعَلَ اللَّهُ لَكَ فِي ذَلِكَ مِنْ خِيَرَةٍ ثُمَّ قَالَ مَا حُبِسَ عَبْدٌ عَنْ هَذَا الْبَيْتِ إِلَّا بِذَنْبٍ وَ مَا يَعْفُو أَكْثَرُ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Muhammad Bin Al Husayn, from Al nazar Bin Shuayd, from Yunus Bin Imran Bin Maysam, from Sama’at,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said to me: ‘What is the matter with you, not performing the Hajj in the year?’ So I said, ‘There are dealings between me and the people, and I am occupied, and perhaps that would happen to be better (next time)’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘No, by Allah<sup>azwj</sup>! Allah<sup>azwj</sup> will not Do good for you in that’. Then he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Nothing withholds a servant from this House (Kaaba) except him being with sins, and (he should) ask for excessive Forgiveness.
en.sarwar: 1. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Muhammad ibn al-Husayn from al-Nadr ibn Shu’ayb from Yunus ibn ‘Imran ibn Mitham from Sama‘ah who has said the following: “Abu ‘ Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, once said to me, ‘Why should you not perform al-Hajj this year?’ I replied, ‘There is a business between me and a people, other preoccupation in which perhaps there is goodness.’ He (the Imam) said, ‘No, by Allah, Allah has not done anything good for you in this.’ He (the Imam) then said, ‘No other thing prevents a servant (of Allah) from this House except sin and what is forgiven is greater.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (7/153)
text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ رَفَعَهُ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) لَيْسَ فِي تَرْكِ الْحَجِّ خِيَرَةٌ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, raising it,
‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no goodness in neglecting the Hajj’.
en.sarwar: 2. A number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn Ziyad in a marfu‘ manner who has said the following: “Abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that there is nothing of goodness in neglecting al-Hajj.”
